info.title: Microsoft NetApp

put.summary: Create the specified volume group and volumes. Creating volume group will create all the volumes specified in request body implicitly. Once volumes are created using volume group, those will be treated as regular volumes thereafter.
put.description: Create a volume group along with specified volumes

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Volume Group object supplied in the body of the operation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Delete the specified volume group only if there are no volumes under volume group.

202.description: Accepted -- Delete request accepted; operation will complete asynchronously

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

OperationListResult.description: Result of the request to list Cloud Volume operations. It contains a list of operations and a URL link to get the next set of results.

value.description: List of Storage operations supported by the Storage resource provider.

display.description: Display metadata associated with the operation.

resource.description: Resource on which the operation is performed etc.

operation.description: Type of operation: get, read, delete, etc.

properties.description: Properties of operation, include metric specifications.

OperationProperties.description: Properties of operation, include metric specifications.

serviceSpecification.description: One property of operation, include metric specifications.

ServiceSpecification.description: One property of operation, include metric specifications.

unit.description: Unit could be Bytes or Count.

supportedTimeGrainTypes.description: The supported time grain types for the metrics.

enableRegionalMdmAccount.description: Whether or not the service is using regional MDM accounts.

dimensions.description: Dimensions of blobs, including blob type and access tier.

fillGapWithZero.description: The property to decide fill gap with zero or not.

category.description: The category this metric specification belong to, could be Capacity.

LogSpecification.description: Log Definition of a single resource metric.

Dimension.description: Dimension of blobs, possibly be blob type or access tier.

CheckAvailabilityResponse.description: Information regarding availability of a resource.

isAvailable.description: true indicates name is valid and available. false indicates the name is invalid, unavailable, or both.

reason.description: Invalid indicates the name provided does not match Azure App Service naming requirements. AlreadyExists indicates that the name is already in use and is therefore unavailable.

message.description: If reason == invalid, provide the user with the reason why the given name is invalid, and provide the resource naming requirements so that the user can select a valid name. If reason == AlreadyExists, explain that resource name is already in use, and direct them to select a different name.

FilePathAvailabilityRequest.description: File path availability request content - availability is based on the name and the subnetId.

subnetId.description: The Azure Resource URI for a delegated subnet. Must have the delegation Microsoft.NetApp/volumes

name.description: Name of the resource to verify.

systemData.description: The system meta data relating to this resource.

default.description: The default quota value.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of results.

etag.description: A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

systemData.description: The system meta data relating to this resource.

username.description: Username of Active Directory domain administrator

password.description: Plain text password of Active Directory domain administrator, value is masked in the response

domain.description: Name of the Active Directory domain

dns.description: Comma separated list of DNS server IP addresses (IPv4 only) for the Active Directory domain

values.description: Active Directory created but not in use
Active Directory in use by SMB Volume

statusDetails.description: Any details in regards to the Status of the Active Directory

smbServerName.description: NetBIOS name of the SMB server. This name will be registered as a computer account in the AD and used to mount volumes

organizationalUnit.description: The Organizational Unit (OU) within the Windows Active Directory

site.description: The Active Directory site the service will limit Domain Controller discovery to

backupOperators.description: Users to be added to the Built-in Backup Operator active directory group. A list of unique usernames without domain specifier

administrators.description: Users to be added to the Built-in Administrators active directory group. A list of unique usernames without domain specifier

kdcIP.description: kdc server IP addresses for the active directory machine. This optional parameter is used only while creating kerberos volume.

adName.description: Name of the active directory machine. This optional parameter is used only while creating kerberos volume

serverRootCACertificate.description: When LDAP over SSL/TLS is enabled, the LDAP client is required to have base64 encoded Active Directory Certificate Service's self-signed root CA certificate, this optional parameter is used only for dual protocol with LDAP user-mapping volumes.

aesEncryption.description: If enabled, AES encryption will be enabled for SMB communication.

ldapSigning.description: Specifies whether or not the LDAP traffic needs to be signed.

securityOperators.description: Domain Users in the Active directory to be given SeSecurityPrivilege privilege (Needed for SMB Continuously available shares for SQL). A list of unique usernames without domain specifier

ldapOverTLS.description: Specifies whether or not the LDAP traffic needs to be secured via TLS.

allowLocalNfsUsersWithLdap.description: If enabled, NFS client local users can also (in addition to LDAP users) access the NFS volumes.

encryptDCConnections.description: If enabled, Traffic between the SMB server to Domain Controller (DC) will be encrypted.

keySource.description: Encryption Key Source. Possible values are: 'Microsoft.NetApp'.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of results.

etag.description: A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

poolId.title: poolId
poolId.description: UUID v4 used to identify the Pool

size.title: size
size.description: Provisioned size of the pool (in bytes). Allowed values are in 4TiB chunks (value must be multiply of 4398046511104).

totalThroughputMibps.description: Total throughput of pool in Mibps

utilizedThroughputMibps.description: Utilized throughput of pool in Mibps

qosType.title: qosType
qosType.description: The qos type of the pool

coolAccess.description: If enabled (true) the pool can contain cool Access enabled volumes.

encryptionType.title: encryptionType
encryptionType.description: Encryption type of the capacity pool, set encryption type for data at rest for this pool and all volumes in it. This value can only be set when creating new pool.

values.description: EncryptionType Single, volumes will use single encryption at rest
EncryptionType Double, volumes will use double encryption at rest

size.title: size
size.description: Provisioned size of the pool (in bytes). Allowed values are in 4TiB chunks (value must be multiply of 4398046511104).

qosType.title: qosType
qosType.description: The qos type of the pool

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of results.

etag.description: A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

principalId.description: Object id of the identity resource

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the resource

type.description: Type of Identity. Supported values are: 'None', 'SystemAssigned'

resourceTags.description: Tags are a list of key-value pairs that describe the resource

creationToken.title: Creation Token or File Path
creationToken.description: A unique file path for the volume. Used when creating mount targets

usageThreshold.title: usageThreshold
usageThreshold.description: Maximum storage quota allowed for a file system in bytes. This is a soft quota used for alerting only. Minimum size is 100 GiB. Upper limit is 100TiB. Specified in bytes.

protocolTypes.title: protocolTypes
protocolTypes.description: Set of protocol types, default NFSv3, CIFS for SMB protocol

snapshotId.title: Snapshot ID
snapshotId.description: UUID v4 or resource identifier used to identify the Snapshot.

backupId.title: Backup ID
backupId.description: UUID v4 or resource identifier used to identify the Backup.

subnetId.description: The Azure Resource URI for a delegated subnet. Must have the delegation Microsoft.NetApp/volumes

networkFeatures.title: Network features
networkFeatures.description: Basic network, or Standard features available to the volume.

networkSiblingSetId.title: Network Sibling Set ID
networkSiblingSetId.description: Network Sibling Set ID for the the group of volumes sharing networking resources.

storageToNetworkProximity.title: Storage to Network Proximity
storageToNetworkProximity.description: Provides storage to network proximity information for the volume.

values.description: Standard T1 storage to network connectivity.
Standard T2 storage to network connectivity.

volumeType.description: What type of volume is this. For destination volumes in Cross Region Replication, set type to DataProtection

dataProtection.title: DataProtection
dataProtection.description: DataProtection type volumes include an object containing details of the replication

snapshotDirectoryVisible.description: If enabled (true) the volume will contain a read-only snapshot directory which provides access to each of the volume's snapshots (default to true).

kerberosEnabled.description: Describe if a volume is KerberosEnabled. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later

securityStyle.description: The security style of volume, default unix, defaults to ntfs for dual protocol or CIFS protocol

smbEncryption.description: Enables encryption for in-flight smb3 data. Only applicable for SMB/DualProtocol volume. To be used with swagger version 2020-08-01 or later

smbContinuouslyAvailable.description: Enables continuously available share property for smb volume. Only applicable for SMB volume

throughputMibps.title: Maximum throughput in Mibps that can be achieved by this volume and this will be accepted as input only for manual qosType volume

encryptionKeySource.description: Encryption Key Source. Possible values are: 'Microsoft.NetApp'

ldapEnabled.description: Specifies whether LDAP is enabled or not for a given NFS volume.

coolAccess.description: Specifies whether Cool Access(tiering) is enabled for the volume.

coolnessPeriod.description: Specifies the number of days after which data that is not accessed by clients will be tiered.

unixPermissions.description: UNIX permissions for NFS volume accepted in octal 4 digit format. First digit selects the set user ID(4), set group ID (2) and sticky (1) attributes. Second digit selects permission for the owner of the file: read (4), write (2) and execute (1). Third selects permissions for other users in the same group. the fourth for other users not in the group. 0755 - gives read/write/execute permissions to owner and read/execute to group and other users.

cloneProgress.description: When a volume is being restored from another volume's snapshot, will show the percentage completion of this cloning process. When this value is empty/null there is no cloning process currently happening on this volume. This value will update every 5 minutes during cloning.

avsDataStore.title: avsDataStore
avsDataStore.description: Specifies whether the volume is enabled for Azure VMware Solution (AVS) datastore purpose

isDefaultQuotaEnabled.description: Specifies if default quota is enabled for the volume.

defaultUserQuotaInKiBs.description: Default user quota for volume in KiBs. If isDefaultQuotaEnabled is set, the minimum value of 4 KiBs applies .

defaultGroupQuotaInKiBs.description: Default group quota for volume in KiBs. If isDefaultQuotaEnabled is set, the minimum value of 4 KiBs applies.

capacityPoolResourceId.description: Pool Resource Id used in case of creating a volume through volume group

proximityPlacementGroup.description: Proximity placement group associated with the volume

volumeSpecName.description: Volume spec name is the application specific designation or identifier for the particular volume in a volume group for e.g. data, log

placementRules.title: Volume placement rules
placementRules.description: Application specific placement rules for the particular volume

kerberos5ReadOnly.description: Kerberos5 Read only access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later

kerberos5ReadWrite.description: Kerberos5 Read and write access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later

kerberos5iReadOnly.description: Kerberos5i Read only access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later

kerberos5iReadWrite.description: Kerberos5i Read and write access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later

kerberos5pReadOnly.description: Kerberos5p Read only access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later

kerberos5pReadWrite.description: Kerberos5p Read and write access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later

nfsv3.description: Allows NFSv3 protocol. Enable only for NFSv3 type volumes

nfsv41.description: Allows NFSv4.1 protocol. Enable only for NFSv4.1 type volumes

allowedClients.description: Client ingress specification as comma separated string with IPv4 CIDRs, IPv4 host addresses and host names

chownMode.description: This parameter specifies who is authorized to change the ownership of a file. restricted - Only root user can change the ownership of the file. unrestricted - Non-root users can change ownership of files that they own.

endpointType.description: Indicates whether the local volume is the source or destination for the Volume Replication

remoteVolumeResourceId.description: The resource ID of the remote volume.

remoteVolumeRegion.description: The remote region for the other end of the Volume Replication.

errorMessage.description: Displays error message if the replication is in an error state

usageThreshold.title: usageThreshold
usageThreshold.description: Maximum storage quota allowed for a file system in bytes. This is a soft quota used for alerting only. Minimum size is 100 GiB. Upper limit is 100TiB. Specified in bytes.

throughputMibps.title: Maximum throughput in Mibps that can be achieved by this volume and this will be accepted as input only for manual qosType volume

dataProtection.title: DataProtection
dataProtection.description: DataProtection type volumes include an object containing details of the replication

isDefaultQuotaEnabled.description: Specifies if default quota is enabled for the volume.

defaultUserQuotaInKiBs.description: Default user quota for volume in KiBs. If isDefaultQuotaEnabled is set, the minimum value of 4 KiBs applies .

defaultGroupQuotaInKiBs.description: Default group quota for volume in KiBs. If isDefaultQuotaEnabled is set, the minimum value of 4 KiBs applies.

mountTargetId.title: mountTargetId
mountTargetId.description: UUID v4 used to identify the MountTarget

fileSystemId.title: fileSystemId
fileSystemId.description: UUID v4 used to identify the MountTarget

smbServerFqdn.title: smbServerFQDN
smbServerFqdn.description: The SMB server's Fully Qualified Domain Name, FQDN

snapshotId.title: snapshotId
snapshotId.description: UUID v4 used to identify the Snapshot

created.title: name
created.description: The creation date of the snapshot

enabled.description: The property to decide policy is enabled or not

etag.description: A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

snapshotPolicyPatch.description: Snapshot policy Details for create and update

minute.description: Indicates which minute snapshot should be taken

usedBytes.description: Resource size in bytes, current storage usage for the volume in bytes

hour.description: Indicates which hour in UTC timezone a snapshot should be taken

minute.description: Indicates which minute snapshot should be taken

usedBytes.description: Resource size in bytes, current storage usage for the volume in bytes

weeklySchedule.description: Weekly Schedule properties, make a snapshot every week at a specific day or days

day.description: Indicates which weekdays snapshot should be taken, accepts a comma separated list of week day names in english

hour.description: Indicates which hour in UTC timezone a snapshot should be taken

minute.description: Indicates which minute snapshot should be taken

usedBytes.description: Resource size in bytes, current storage usage for the volume in bytes

daysOfMonth.description: Indicates which days of the month snapshot should be taken. A comma delimited string.

hour.description: Indicates which hour in UTC timezone a snapshot should be taken

minute.description: Indicates which minute snapshot should be taken

usedBytes.description: Resource size in bytes, current storage usage for the volume in bytes

volumeRevert.description: revert a volume to the snapshot

remoteVolumeResourceId.description: Resource id of the remote volume

forceBreakReplication.description: If replication is in status transferring and you want to force break the replication, set to true

newPoolResourceId.description: Resource id of the pool to move volume to

backupId.title: backupId
backupId.description: UUID v4 used to identify the Backup

creationDate.title: creationDate
creationDate.description: The creation date of the backup

backupType.title: backupType
backupType.description: Type of backup Manual or Scheduled

useExistingSnapshot.description: Manual backup an already existing snapshot. This will always be false for scheduled backups and true/false for manual backups

enabled.description: The property to decide policy is enabled or not

volumeBackups.description: A list of volumes assigned to this policy

etag.description: A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

backupPolicyPatch.description: Backup policy Details for create and update

volumeBackups.description: Volume details using the backup policy

backupsCount.description: Total count of backups for volume

relationshipStatus.description: Status of the backup mirror relationship

unhealthyReason.description: Reason for the unhealthy backup relationship

errorMessage.description: Displays error message if the backup is in an error state

relationshipStatus.description: Status of the restore SnapMirror relationship

unhealthyReason.description: Reason for the unhealthy restore relationship

errorMessage.description: Displays error message if the restore is in an error state

cloudError.description: An error response from the service.

code.description: An identifier for the error. Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.

message.description: A message describing the error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

cloudErrorBody.description: An error response from the service.

serviceLevel.title: serviceLevel
serviceLevel.description: The service level of the file system

globalPlacementRules.title: Global volume placement rules
globalPlacementRules.description: Application specific placement rules for the volume group

deploymentSpecId.description: Application specific identifier of deployment rules for the volume group

volumesCount.description: Number of volumes in volume group

placementKeyValuePairs.description: Application specific parameters for the placement of volumes in the volume group

key.description: Key for an application specific parameter for the placement of volumes in the volume group

value.description: Value for an application specific parameter for the placement of volumes in the volume group

SubscriptionId.name: subscriptionId
SubscriptionId.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

ResourceGroup.name: resourceGroupName
ResourceGroup.description: The name of the resource group.

AccountName.description: The name of the NetApp account

MountTargetName.description: The name of the mount target

SnapshotPolicyName.description: The name of the snapshot policy
